item.title: Ars spoke with the military’s chief orbital traffic cop—here’s what we learned

item.title: This Star System Contains 5 Potentially Habitable Planets
item.description: Astronomers have discovered a new exoplanet that may be habitable 35 light-years from Earth. Named L 98-59 f, it joins four other worlds in the temperate zone of an intriguing planetary system.

item.description: China’s Space Pioneer seems to be back on track a year after an accidental launch.

item.title: Lawmakers writing NASA’s budget want a cheaper upper stage for the SLS rocket
item.description: Eliminating the Block 1B upgrade now would save NASA at least $500 million per year.

item.title: What exactly is Golden Dome? This Space Force general owes Trump an answer.

item.title: South Korea Plans to Build a Base on the Moon
item.description: The country’s newly formed space agency wants to establish a lunar base by 2045.

item.title: A Top NASA Official Is Among Thousands of Staff Leaving the Agency

item.title: Trump wants to “eliminate or expedite” environmental rules for rocket launches

item.title: Newly Discovered ‘Infinity Galaxy’ Could Prove How Ancient Supermassive Black Holes Formed
item.description: This collision of two galaxies could demonstrate that theorized “direct collapse black holes” exist.

item.title: The Hunt for a Fundamental Theory of Quantum Gravity
item.description: Black hole and Big Bang singularities break our best theory of gravity. A trilogy of theorems hints that physicists must go to the ends of space and time to find a fix.

item.title: We saw the heart of Pluto 10 years ago—it’ll be a long wait to see the rest
item.description: A 50-year wait for a second mission wouldn’t be surprising. Just ask Uranus and Neptune.

item.title: The Structure of Ice in Space Is Neither Order nor Chaos—It’s Both
item.description: Long thought to be completely disordered, space ice appears to have some crystallized regions, new research suggests.

item.title: Everything We Know About the Interstellar Object 3I/ATLAS
item.description: A team of astronomers recently discovered the traveling space object, just the third of its kind to pass through our solar system.

item.title: How to Watch the Southern Delta Aquariids and Perseids Meteor Showers
item.description: In July and August two spectacular meteor showers will arrive in quick succession. Here’s everything you need to know to watch them and the other major showers that will appear in 2025.
